body: Meanwhile, Nidalee gets a free 500 range gap closer that has an execute mechanic on it. That's totally balanced. /sarcasm

We're mad that Riot is CLEARLY making a huge double standard. Why does Kassadin have his ult nerfed severely (even if it functions like Kog's ult, and is quite frankly the only person I can think of that pays very heavily for his mobility) if other champions have just as good mobility on much lower cooldowns with barely any cost on non-ultimate abilities. Why does Kass lose his ult when one can get just as much range with Lee Q + wardhop, or Yasuo + minion wave, or Kalista + anything, or Nidalee + hunted target??

The reason people don't really care about the above stated is because most of those require some other thing to be done, whereas Kassadin just ults freely with no constraints other than mana. Nidalee has to either land a spear or trap to make it work, Kalista needs to Q or find something to attack, Yasuo needs a minion wave or plenty of other targets of some type, Lee Sin has to buy sightstone to get a ward hop whenever he might need it, ect.

I can see what they mean, but Kass has not been a problem as of recently. He may have a high ban rate, but he's barely picked more than Malphite in ranked games. Kass's first round of nerfs (main case being ult damage taken and Q silence removed, along with slightly slashed AP ratios) I think put him in a really good spot. He can't instantly burst people down quite as easily, but you could still kill people given enough effort. All of his abilities are short range, requiring you to ult to use any of them. If you lost the ult range for a slightly non-glorified flash (with the scaling costs, might I add), then he won't get in range to do anything, and he won't be able to do much. He's already near-useless pre-6, he shouldn't also be useless post-6.

All those other champions come complimented with tons of damage, Lee Sin also gets some tankiness as well. Given you can catch up to Kassadin, his damage will be somewhat lacking. You probably know trying to chase Kalista is suicide, just because she has both sustained, burst, and poke damage along with insane mobility all in one kit. We're mad that Kassadin, probably the least of any offender (other than the occasional mobile tank) for this mobility creep situation, and HE is receiving nerfs. Kassadin has a 99.4% ban rate early 2014. After the nerfs, he was practically unseen in ranked. We feel Kassadin nerfs were unjustified, because he was already in a somewhat good spot.

Riot needs to stop making all of these double standards. It's really getting annoying.

IMO, mobility creep isnt THAT big of a deal.  Obviously, its still a problem (lookin at you, {{champion:429}} although she got nerfed.)

Mobility is one of the funnest aspects of LoL, but Champs need to pay for it. 

There are four pillars of power in LoL-

Mobility
Damage
Utility
and CC.

The problem with mobility creep is a champ being strong in mobility, AND damage, AND cc.

Mobile champs just need to be toned back in one other area.
I'm sorry, but what melee carries have been pushed out?

Mobility might be fun, but so too are a lot of mechanics in the game that get pushed out because of mobility.  Riot can't have traditional melee carries because of their mobility creep, needing to either have them function like bruisers or assassins.  Channel ultimates are becoming less and less useful due to the abundance of gapclosers letting the enemy avoid your telegraphed target.  Even zone control mechanics get weaker when mobility remains strong for so long (and it has).

I agree that Riot needs to manage their power budgets differently, but I think the raw amount of mobility is also a problem, even if accurately accounted for in power budgets, because it limits future game design to mechanics that aren't useless versus mobility.

Kassadin was a problem. (not sure if this was the right direction but I'm all for anything that decreases mobility)

He lost quite a bit of damage during the first round of nerfs. He's also pretty short range, so he needs to ult to get into range a lot of the times.

I think that maybe the ult range nerf could be justified, but they should probably do something about the scaling mana cost if it's just going to be a slightly damaging flash. That's really my complaint with this, is that they're keeping the scaling cost when others have plain better mobility than him at next to no costs.

Kassadin's ult was too crazy in terms of range. I'd say in most games he nearly would always survive team fights just because of ult + burst + hour glass + ult again + ult again. It still crosses nearly every wall even after it's range reduction, so it is still possible for him to abuse his ultimate like he previously did. The problem with kassadin was low risk high reward in conjunction of escaping or catching people due to the distance. This gives people more wiggle room to catch him or escape him. 

His laning phase is still fine with his Q (and magic shield) still allowing him to bully and him innately reducing magic damage. Possibly with range reduction he can get a minor buff in the future but nothing big. He is a champion that is hard to balance mostly because of his ultimate. He is too good at everything and needs to find a healthy medium between the laning phase and roaming. There needs to be risks involved and for many years he was a champion with very little risk.

He currently is not "gutted" or over nerfed. He will still pub stomp and he will still burst people out. He now needs to make smarter choices however when planning his escape or trying to catch somebody. This is "risk"

Kassadin had 90% pick/ban rate in most competitive environments, he clearly had to go. I believe what really pushed Kass over the edge competitively were the consistent nerfs to early game jungling, which makes it impossible to punish him for his terrible pre-6, and once he has his ult, ganks don't matter.

Fixing the jungle would have fixed Kass, at least made him healthy enough not to warrant this brutal nerf (it's not like anyone is happy about the current jungle anyways) but since they didn't do it, they had to kill him.

Sources please???

Yeah, he's around 6th top ban in all regions, but he's got an 8.3% pick rate with a 46.97% win rate (From one of my posts before, it was a 9.87% pick rate with around 47% winrate. He's actually *dropped*) [My source](http://www.lolking.net/champions/)

While I like that you are willing to think about the indirect effects that nerfing the jungle has on other positions, Kassadin lost a huge amount of damage after his silence was taken (as well as losing some due to casual love taps). Those, some argue put him in a good place, while others argue it really ruined his role as an assassin.

Then you have this nerf. This nerf, where everyone that plays Kassadin can wholeheartedly agree is making him utterly useless. He has low range on all of his abilities now, and he has a massive scaling mana cost on the only move that gives him mobility, which is now a non-glorified flash.

If Riot wanted to make sure Kass wasn't oppressive, or any laner for that matter, because of a lack of early ganks, then they should make early jungle easier rather than punish Kassadin even more when he was perfectly fine.
